text: Freedom Farms Cooperative was an agricultural cooperative in Sunflower County, Mississippi, founded by American civil rights activist Fannie Lou Hamer in 1967 as a community based rural and economic development project. In 1969 Hamer received a $10,000 donation from Measure for Measure, a charitable organization based in Madison, Wisconsin. The FFC ended in the mid 1970s. ==References== Category:Agricultural cooperatives in the United States Category:Former cooperatives of the United States Category:Sunflower County, Mississippi Category:History of agriculture in the United States Category:Worker cooperatives of the United States
title: Freedom Farm Cooperative
